dt: {bc}settlement of differences by {d_link|arbitration|arbitration} or by consent reached by mutual concessions
{bc}something {d_link|intermediate|intermediate:1} between or blending qualities of two different things

quotes.t: I therefore proposed a … strategy that raised the possibility of {qword}compromise{/qword} …

"You can't always come up with the optimal solution, but you can usually come up with a better solution," he [Barack Obama] said over lunch one afternoon. "A good {qword}compromise{/qword}, a good piece of legislation, is like a good sentence."
In his promotion of burgeoning black writers, however, Hughes made no {qword}compromises{/qword}.
I've had other films that were successful, but I'm aware of the {qword}compromises{/qword} I made—and they were tremendous.

et: Middle English, mutual promise to abide by an arbiter's decision, from Anglo-French {it}compromisse{/it}, from Latin {it}compromissum{/it}, from neuter of {it}compromissus{/it}, past participle of {it}compromittere{/it} to promise mutually, from {it}com-{/it} + {it}promittere{/it} to promise {ma}{mat|promise|}{/ma}
shortdef: settlement of differences by arbitration or by consent reached by mutual concessions
something intermediate between or blending qualities of two different things
a concession to something derogatory or prejudicial

dt: {bc}to come to agreement by mutual concession

dt.t: The two sides were unwilling to {wi}compromise{/wi}.
The union and employer agreed to {wi}compromise{/wi}.

dt: {bc}to find or follow a way between extremes
{bc}to make a shameful or disreputable concession
{bc}to reveal or expose to an unauthorized person and especially to an enemy

dt.t: illnesses that can seriously {wi}compromise{/wi} the immune system
If you don't acknowledge the parent at all, you risk seeming unnecessarily hostile or dismissive but if you allow the parent to govern decisions you could {wi}compromise{/wi} the patient.

dt: {bc}to expose to suspicion, discredit, or mischief

dt.t: An arbiter was brought in to {wi}compromise{/wi} their differences.

quotes.t: Lieutenant Charon would get a pat on the back from his captain … not to mention congratulations for running such a quiet and effective operation that had not {qword}compromised{/qword} his informants …
Our plan had been to pass a good balanced budget without {qword}compromising{/qword} its essential components …
The book is {qword}compromised{/qword} by the author's lack of selectivity.
You don't make deals that {qword}compromise{/qword} yourself or your team, of course, but you help other riders if you can, so they might return the favor.
Finally, the two sides {qword}compromised{/qword} and a treaty was signed …

shortdef: to come to agreement by mutual concession
to find or follow a way between extremes
to make a shameful or disreputable concession

dt: {bc}to give up something (in order to get along, come to an agreement, etc.)

dt.t: Both boys will have to {it}make compromises{/it} if they are to share the room.

shortdef: to give up something (in order to get along, come to an agreement, etc.)
